reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel for a 3 day break through Visit Scotland and chose from a choice of 2 they gave us. I recall fairly specifically being advised that both offered "parking". As a previous writer has stated this is not on site and is an NCP car park a couple of hundred yards away. Leave your cases in reception before parking. Our only gripe has to be the noise caused by people leaving a nearby pub or club, we were on the second floor facing the street and were disturbed every night. The lack of double glazing does not help. If you are a sound sleeper or use earplugs then you should have no worries about the hotel, the staff are excellent, the bar and lounge areas are very pleasant and the food very good (although the eat as much as you like breakfast buffet could be a bit more appetising). Our room was a large double with a comfortable bed and pleasant and relaxing lounge area.
reviews.title: Shame about the noise

reviews.text: Stayed here with two friends while in Aberdeen for a gig. The staff were lovely and went out of their way to help us. Its very handy for the train/bus station, and everything is within walking distance.
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel!!

likes.liked: — I really liked the location, and felt well treated by the staff.
likes.disliked: — There wasnt anything i disliked about this accommodation

reviews.text: The actual hotel is very pleasant, well kept and clean. Our room was lovely, we got a triple room and it was very spacious, with a sofa and table as well as plenty of room for the beds etc, so we didnt feel at all cramped together.
reviews.title: Good functional hotel
Now The Douglas
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again, the prices were great, along with the staff and the facilities!!
